Class SuperSocketMaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • SuperSocketMaster
  • public class SuperSocketMaster
extends java.lang.Object

    SuperSocketMaster

    This class gives Java students the ability to quickly open a Java network socket

    They can then send outgoing text over the socket

    They can recieve incoming text over the socket

    Incoming text triggers an ActionEvent

    This class is meant to be used in Java Swing/AWT programs

    Since:
    2016-04-21

    • Constructor Detail

      • SuperSocketMaster

        public SuperSocketMaster​(int intPort,
                         java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Server Mode SuperSocketMaster Constructor

        Parameters:
        intPort - TCP Port you want to use for your connection
        listener - Swing/AWT program's ActionListener. Usually "this"

      • SuperSocketMaster

        public SuperSocketMaster​(java.lang.String strServerIP,
                         int intPort,
                         java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
        Client Mode SuperSocketMaster Constructor

        Parameters:
        strServerIP - Hostname or IP address of the server you want to connect to
        intPort - TCP Port you want to use for your connection
        listener - Swing/AWT program's ActionListener. Usually "this"

    • Method Detail

      • sendText

        public boolean sendText​(java.lang.String strText)
        Sends text over the open socket

        If the socket is not open, the text goes nowhere

        You can use this to check to see of the socket is still open

        Parameters:
        strText - Text you want to send over the network socket
        Returns:
        Returns true if data was successfully sent over the network

      • readText

        public java.lang.String readText()
        Reads the text that was recieved from the open socket

        Should only be called after and ActionEvent is triggered

        Returns:
        Returns recieved text from the socket or an empty string

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects all open sockets

        Servers will disconnect all clients before closing the server socket

        Clients will disconnect their socket connection to the server

      • getMyAddress

        public java.lang.String getMyAddress()
        Gets the IP Address of the computer

        Should grab the Ethernet IP first if both Wifi and Ethernet are connected

        Returns:
        Returns computer's IP address

      • getMyHostname

        public java.lang.String getMyHostname()
        Gets the Hostname of the computer
        Returns:
        Returns computer's Hostname

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Opens a socket connection

        Server - Opens a server socket and waits for clients to connect

        Client - Opens a socket and connects to the server

        Once connected, both start a thread to listen for incoming clients or incoming text

        Returns:
        Returns true if socket connection was successfull
